sub_title: Industrialization Engineer | Changing the world one nanometer at a time @ASML
summary:
A motivated Mechanical Engineer with a strong background in technical documentation for automotive, aerospace, and technology companies. An experienced technical writer of the Airbus Military aircrafts (A330-MRTT, A400M, and Eurofighter) and Google Data Center Hardware Operations manuals. Relevant experience with product engineering development focused on noise, vibration, and harshness analysis in vehicle transmissions and gearboxes. 

A self-starter and driven professional who can efficiently work both independently and within a team. Passionate about technology, engineering, teaching, and writing.

Highly skilled in knowledge keeping and hands-on engineering works. Strong capacity for multicultural and international teamwork. I have Portuguese as a native language, English and Spanish fluent. 

Specialties: Technical Writing, Training Manuals, Knowledge Management, Authoring Tools, Style Guides, User Guides, Engineering Documentation, Team Work.

Tools: Google developer tools (Cider, Critique, and Codesearch), Markdown, HTML, CSS, S1000D / ASD-STE100, Arbortext Editor (EPIC), Airn@v, IETP, CSDB, SAP, Sharepoint, JIRA, SAMANTA Military, Office 365

certifications.name: Tanker Familiarization Course - Airbus A330 MRTT
Yellow Belt - Lean and Six Sigma - DMAIC Methodology

courses.name: Green Belt - Design for Six Sigma (DFSS)

profile_positions.description:
The primary goal is to enable flawless introduction and execution of field service and manufacturing activities.
Key contributor to the Product Generation Process which comprises the Feasibility, System Design, Detailed design & Realization, Production Volume Preparation, Sustainability and End of Manufacturing of a designated product. 
Main focus on the early design phases that determine the serviceability and manufacturability of the product until its actual transfer to the field via trainings and technical instructions. The end result is to obtain an effective and efficient execution of the assembly, testing, servicing and troubleshooting of the latest generation of Semiconductor Lithography Systems.

Tasks
New product design and development:
 - Create impact analysis and serviceability/manufacturability requirements for new designs.
 - Review new designs and assure internal customer requirements are taken into account.
 - Define and create the necessary service and manufacturing activities (diagnostics, part swapping and system recovery).
 - Search for continuous improvement that results in: 
 ○ Cycle-time reduction 
 ○ Machine downtime reduction
Field & Factory Introduction
 - Qualify Field and Factory teams to execute service and manufacturing activities by developing clear work instructions, and defining necessary tools & parts.
 - Train Field and Factory teams.
 - Transfer know-how to first line support teams to execute troubleshooting on product performance issues.
Field & Factory Support
 - Contribute to rapid and effective solutions of complex system issues.
 - Represent ASML by providing necessary international field support at customer and supplier sites.
General
 - Knowledge link between development and operational sectors.
 - Focus in minimizing operational costs for volume products.
 - Prioritize Reliability, Availability, Manufacturability, and Serviceability of the product during the development process.
profile_positions.title: Technical Author | Industrialization Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Development & Engineering (D&E) Technical Author responsible to create and maintain the technical communication needed to build and service ASML machines in the factory and field, based on the input of the manufacturing and equipment engineers. Part of High Power Seed Module (HPSM) and Drive Laser team of the Twinscan Source family for Extreme Ultra-Violet (EUV) machines.

Main tasks:
- Create and edit all technical documentation for Equipment and/or Manufacturing Engineering and be the main interface for all authoring related issues, tooling and processes.
Types of documentation: Procedures (Install, Removal, Adjustment, Calibration, Diagnostics, etc), Field Change Order (FCO), Deterministic Diagnostic Flow (DDF), Newsflash, comments, etc.
- Convert input from engineers, suppliers and/or development documentation into effective technical documentation for ASML products according to the specifications and standards.
- Create and make changes to illustrations and convert illustrations to the required publishing format.
- Use documentation tools and apply the ASML style to the created or modified documents.
- Specify requirements concerning illustrations, technical input or user feedback.
- Signal problems with technical documentation and propose scenarios for solutions or escalate.
- First point of contact on issues with documentation relating to the various projects and for handling incoming comments.

The workflow patterns are based on the Scaled Agile Frame Work (SAFe). Along with large-scale Scrum, SAFe is one of a growing number of frameworks that seek to address the problems encountered when scaling beyond a single team.
profile_positions.title: Technical Author

profile_positions.description: Engineer technical writer working on the Documentation and Power Academy departments. Responsible for developing and correcting documents and manuals for all Power Electronics products as: Electric Vehicle chargers, Solar Power Plant Inverters, etc. Working with direct contact with clients and other departments as: Applications engineering, Research and Development, Product Quality, etc. Image creation and manipulation. Translations from Spanish and Portuguese to English
profile_positions.title: Engineer Technical Writer

profile_positions.description:
TVC via Morgan Mckinley

Worked as technical writer of hardware operations manuals in Google’s Data Center. Temporary project for standardization of all documentation used for maintenance and operations of all Data
Centers in the world. 

Main activities: Development, creation and correction of new manuals using Markdown and HTML languages; Images editing; Regular meetings with SMEs (Subject-Matter Expert) to project monitoring and evaluation; Work methodology with self-check and cross-check to ensure the best  quality possible. 

Google tools used: Drive, Cider, Critique and Change lists, Buganizer, DC training platform and Hardware Operations (HwOps) Documentation Library.
profile_positions.title: Technical Writer

profile_positions.description:
Worked as an Engineer technical writer for the Combat Technical Publications Department at Airbus Defense and Space for continuing Airworthiness of the EUROFIGHTER aircraft, in order to enable safe and efficient maintenance, retrofit and operation of the aircraft by the air forces. 

My main activities are:
- Developing corrections and updates for all Eurofighter Manuals at IETP (Interactive Electronic Technical Publications) such as: Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM), Structural Repair Manual (SRM), Air Battle Damage Repair Manual (ABDR), etc.
- Common Source Data Base (CSDB) and National Publication Base (NPB) Management
- Customers Support (Updating technical data as required, analyzing customer requests of change on publications and creating every technical content such as instructions and illustrations required by engineering documentation).
profile_positions.title: Eurofighter Technical Publications Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Worked as an Engineer Technical Author of A330 Multi Role Tanker and Transport (MRTT) developing, creating and correcting maintenance training materials to air forces. 

My main activities were: converting technical data into didactic manuals through collecting information from different Air Transport Association (ATAs) on AIRBUS manuals from the ADOC N@vigator as: Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM), Structure Repair Manual (SRM) and from Flight Crew Operation Manual (FCOM) and Mission Console Operation Manual (MCOM) entering it into the program SBT3 (Text editor) and establishing instructions to change images in the manuals. 

Member of Training Needs Analysis (TNA) department of the maintenance team. Furthermore, I attended to debriefings with ATEXIS and AIRBUS managers to collect feedback on the material and I also had the opportunity to certificate as B1 level on A330 MRTT Tanker Familiarization (FAM) course.

Also worked on the Illustrated Parts Data / Catalog (IPD / IPC) of the AIRBUS A400M project updating and developing improvements and corrections in the manual. Main activities: Study the Work Order (WO) through the SAP tool to verify its impact on the IPD. WOs are divided by correction / improvement criteria (Service bulletins, Modifications, Retrofit, etc.) that may come from AIRBUS or the air forces. For WOs with an impact on the manual, the authoring process was carried out in SAP and the changes always reached the client in the subsequent update of the manual. The work had double verification: the first one by Atexis and the second by Airbus. We kept track of failures and that directly impacted quality index. Creation of Mock-Ups for the graphics department to indicate possible corrections in images.
profile_positions.title: Engineer Technical Writer - Airbus A330 MRTT and A400M

profile_positions.description:
Worked in the Product Engineering as a member of the Center of Excellence focused on NVH in Truck Transmissions. I was part of the team responsible for detecting existing gearboxes problems through root cause analysis. 

My main activities were engineering hands-on as: instrumenting vehicles, collecting and analyzing the data obtained to validate computer models developed jointly by Brazilian and Indian teams and writing technical reports. 

I have also developed a three-wire pendulum to measure pieces inertia and worked with different software such as: Siemens Imagine.Lab Amesim, MATLAB, PTC-Creo, Artemis, Excel, Minitab and Enovia PLM Software. During my internship, I certificated as Yellow Belt in Lean & Six Sigma methodologys.
profile_positions.title: Product Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description:
Worked as Chassis and Marketing Member to design, build and test 3 off-road vehicles to compete in the Baja SAE (Society of Automotive Engineers) competitions in Brazil.
The competition involved both technical skills, building a vehicle from the ground up, and business skills, dealing with sponsors and managing a team of 35 members.
Helped the team to rise from 48th position to 6th in the national competition, in a period of two years.
profile_positions.title: Chassis and Marketing Member

profile_positions.description:
I was selected to be part of an exchange program at Walt Disney World called International College Program (ICP).
There, I had the opportunity to learn the work philosophy that presents excellence in customer service and continuous improvement.
I worked in direct contact with guests, which allowed me to improve even more my English.
profile_positions.title: International College Program

profile_positions.description:
Worked as Project and Marketing member at a junior enterprise.
There, I had a vision of engineering from the point of view of business. We worked with consulting and project management in mechanical engineering.
Also, I was part of a team that organized the XVI Week of Mechanical Engineering at UNICAMP. 
The week aims to bring students from the University to the labor market through technical visits, lectures and short courses.
profile_positions.title: Project and Marketing Member

During my internship, I was able to help teenagers from socially vulnerable families on their learning process.

http://formare.org.br/
